pros: Very friendly people and can be part of work study
cons: Limited hours if you go through work study program

pros: Pay isn't terrible at this point/
cons: No benefits or perks. No sharing of ideas. Everyone works for themselves basically.

pros: Students are wonderful and motivated. The campus is beautiful and close to downtown Rochester.
cons: Difficulty managing interpersonal relationships within the Department.

job_title: Associate Head Coach in Rochester, NY
pros: Flexible, want you to succeed
cons: Salary not competitive, recent change made it better

pros: Nazareth has some of the most supportive co-workers I have seen, and I always feel like my opinion is heard and taken into consideration. At a smaller institution like this, I feel like the work I do has an impact, and can affect change.
cons: Pay is generally less than in industry, and sometimes paths for advancement aren't very visible.

pros: not a good place to work
cons: very racist atmosphere under a surface of community and belonging. A very toxic place to work

pros: Tuition benefits, friendly environment, feel like you are making a difference
cons: Benefits aren't very good (except tuition),

pros: Nice people and nice, close knit community feel
cons: Small community and not as much room for growth outside of the Nazareth community.

job_title: Vice President Enrollment in Rochester, NY
pros: Nice people here - the people are the strength of this institution
cons: everyone is very understaffed, upper management not willing to reduce workload or hire more help

pros: Small college atmosphere allows you to make friends quickly. Devoted faculty and staff who truly care about students. Beautiful campus and physical plant that are well kept and maintained.
cons: Disconnect between senior management and the rest of campus. Much is made of "transparency" but decisions are made behind closed doors with little or no real input from the rest of the community. Oh attempts are made at soliciting this input but one gets the sense that the decisions are either already made or pre-ordained and senior management is only looking to appear to have sought input.

review_title: Good workers are expected to pick up the slack for the squeaky wheels in the department.
pros: Challenging and engaging environment with a few celebrations throughout the year
cons: Minimal salary increases no matter how good your review is for the year. Poor communication within your own department as well as outside. Working reactively vs proactively no matter how hard you try to avoid it.

pros: Jane Shebert, the lab administrator is very well educated in Chemistry and is a pleasure to work under. The entire Chemistry Department at Nazareth is just amazing.
cons: Not many hours available, but its just a small student part time job. I do it more for the experience working in the lab and setting up equipment. And to work with Jane!

review_title: Good place to work, not so great with salary and benefits
pros:
-Tuition benefits for the employee and spouse/children
-Always available parking
-An overall friendly atmosphere
-Being able to attend cultural/artistic events with discounted/free tickets
cons:
-Incomes tend to be low for regular employees (not so much for management and higher administration)
-Opportunities for advancement are limited, due to longevity within management positions
-Very high health benefits monthly fees for employees
-Passive in intervening with low-performing employees

review_title: Good place to work and study
pros: Environment of respect and a great sense of community.
cons: Students do not live up to their potential.  Parents are overly involved in the day to day activities of the students.

pros: Great co-workers and staff who make the bureaucracy almost invisible. Faculty pull together to create a great educational experience for students without excessive hand-holding.
cons: Adjunct pay could be better.

pros: Opportunities for growth, respectful department leaders, focus on continuous development of faculty. Overall a very pleasant place to teach.
cons: Parking is often a problem.

review_title: Worst college to work at on Rochester
pros: Nice buildings and the campus is gorgeous.
cons: Toxic politics, lack of diversity, tolerance for inappropriate conduct for politically connected people

job_title: Manager, Advancement Services in Rochester, NY
pros: It's a smaller school; family feel, you are NOT just a number, you matter; respect for work-life balance.
cons: It is a smaller school.

pros: Because if it is a temporary job does not offer the benefits nor much stability expected.
cons: It is a very stimulating work environment.

pros:
Friendly staff & faculty
Great Students
Beautiful campus
cons:
Very poor training 
Slow management  & administrative offices

job_title: Assistant Director of Admissions in Rochester, NY
pros: you work with student a lot
cons: im really dont have no problems

pros: Good institution to work for, multiple opportunities
cons: Not many cons, if you search you will find opportunities
